column4: I just installed ubuntu using the custom debootstrap method, and when I login through gdm, it sits there with a blank brown screen for about 4 minutes before gnome starts loading
Anybody know whats up?
what hardware are you running?
Intel pentium M, 900MHz, 512 megs ram, though I had an identical problem when I installed with the same method on my faster workstation
The normal install didnt work for you?
I don't have any 700 meg CDs to burn the full install CDs onto :/
have you tried regular cd's
Hmm?
I know the image is larger than that.. but part of that is because it is an image
Err, so I could try burning a 700 meg image onto a 650 disc and hopefully the bit it misses off the end isn't important...?
It may not miss anything
Err... ok, I'll try it.
IF that does not work .. get a 700meg cd.  Around here they are at every grocery store and 7-11
It will stillnot be fast on a 900mhz box (and probably slow ide drives as well)
But 4 minutes of doing nothing?  And the exact same thing on a much faster Athlon 3200+
It isnt doing nothing... it is setting up the system
Are you sure?  This is before it even pops up the gnome loading bit
Start with the standard install and go from there
Ok...
There may be a timer waiting for input etc..
